title: Matildas star Sam Kerr scores epic match - winner to claim FA Cup three - peat with Chelsea
body_text:
Sam Kerr has played a starring role in Chelseaâ€™s third-straight Womenâ€™s FA Cup victory, scoring the gameâ€™s lone goal to beat Manchester United in front of a record crowd at Wembley.
Kerrâ€™s 68th-minute strike broke the deadlock to push her side ahead of United and ultimately proved the difference as Chelsea walked away with the trophy in a 1-0 victory.
Do you like playing at Wembley, @SamKerr1? ğŸ˜‰ #WomensFACupFinal pic.twitter.com/WBkXYdgBmn

It is not the first time the Matildas captain has taken the game into her own hands, scoring a double in both finals against Arsenal and Manchester City in 2021 and 2022.
Her latest FA Cup final goal was scored in front of 77,390 roaring fans, a figure beating the previous record for a womenâ€™s domestic football match - at Atletico Madrid vs Barcelona in 2019 - by 17,000 people.
ICONIC.#WomensFACupFinal pic.twitter.com/sxBiVLIg2j
â€” Chelsea FC Women (@ChelseaFCW) May 14, 2023
Kerr has now struck six goals in five games this season, with a hat-trick in Chelseaâ€™s opening win over Liverpool and the winning strike in their 1-0 semi-final victory over Aston Villa.
With a game in hand, Emma Hayesâ€™ side lies second on the ladder behind United but will have every confidence they can take the lead as the race for the title closes in.
Chelsea midfielder Erin Cuthbert says the victory over United felt good but the desire for even greater achievements has already kicked in.
â€œItâ€™s one piece of the jigsaw. I want more, this isnâ€™t enough," Cuthbert said post-game.
â€œWe want to go for the league now. We can only control the controllables.â€
